english_translation: Narrated by Aisha, Mother of the Believers: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Ghusl (ritual bathing) on Friday is obligatory upon every one who has attained puberty (muhtalem).'

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah and Abu Said al-Khudri: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Whoever performs ghusl on Friday like the ghusl for major ritual impurity (janabah) and then goes, it is as if he offered a camel. Whoever goes in the second hour, it is as if he offered a cow. Whoever goes in the third hour, it is as if he offered a horned ram. Whoever goes in the fourth hour, it is as if he offered a hen. Whoever goes in the fifth hour, it is as if he offered an egg. When the Imam comes out, the angels attend to listen to the remembrance.'

english_translation: Narrated by Jabir ibn Zayd: I witnessed companions of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: 'The Messenger of Allah ﷺ recites on Friday after Surah al-Jumu'ah: Has there come to you the story of al-Ghashiyah, and I have also heard that he recites: Glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High.'

english_translation: Chapter: On the Excellence of Prayer and its Humility

Narrated by Aisha, Mother of the Believers: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Everything has a pillar, and the pillar of religion is prayer. The pillar of prayer is humility. The best of you in the sight of Allah are the most pious.' || Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Do you see my qiblah here? By Allah, my humility and your bowing are not hidden from me, and indeed I see you from behind my back.'

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Indeed the angels pray upon one of you as long as he remains in his prayer place where he prayed, so long as he does not break wind (hadath), and they say: O Allah, forgive him, O Allah, have mercy on him.'

english_translation: From his chain it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Angels take turns with you at night and during the day, and they meet at the Fajr prayer. Then the angels who spent the night with you ascend, and their Lord asks them - and He is most knowing about them - how did you leave My servants? They say: We left them praying and came to them praying.'

english_translation: It reached him from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ that he said: 'Pray and you will succeed, give Zakat and you will prosper, fast and you will be healthy, travel and you will gain wealth.'

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'If people knew what virtue is in the first row, then they would not find anything except to draw lots for it. If they knew what virtue is in arriving early, they would race to it. If they knew what virtue is in the 'Atamah and Subh prayers, they would come to them even if crawling.'

english_translation: Chapter: On the Collection of Prayer
Narrated by Ibn Abbas: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'There is no prayer in the cemetery, nor in the slaughterhouse, nor in the pens of camels, nor on the roadside.'

english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'None of you should pray while binding/tying his hair behind his head.' Meaning: binding his hair in a knot. || Narrated by Ibn Abbas: 'We prayed with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and we never saw him perform qunut (supplication) in his prayer at all.'

english_translation: Chapter: On Fasting in Ramadan During Travel

Narrated by Ibn Abbas: The Prophet ﷺ went out to Makkah in the year of the Conquest in Ramadan and fasted until he reached al-Kadid, then he broke his fast, and the people broke their fast with him. They would follow the latest of the Prophet's ﷺ commands.

Followers of the Prophet's latest command

english_translation: Narrated by Jabir ibn Zayd: I heard a group of the Prophet's ﷺ companions saying: 'We went out with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ in the year of the Conquest in Ramadan. He ordered the people to break their fast, saying: "For strengthening against your enemy." He fasted and did not break it. We saw the Messenger of Allah ﷺ pouring water on his head from the intensity of heat or thirst. It was said to him: O Messenger of Allah, some people have fasted while you have been fasting. When he reached al-Kadid, he called for a drink of water and drank it, and the people broke their fast with him.' || Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: 'We traveled with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and among us were those who fasted and those who broke their fast. Neither the one who fasted blamed the one who broke his fast, nor did the one who broke his fast blame the one who fasted.'

english_translation: Empty entry - no text

Narrated by Ibn Abbas: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Whoever fasts on the day of Ashura (10th of Muharram), it is an expiation for sixty months, or freeing of ten believing females from the offspring of Ishmael ﷺ.' || Narrated by Aisha, Mother of the Believers: The day of Ashura was a day that Quraysh used to fast in the pre-Islamic era, and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ used to fast it in the pre-Islamic era. When he came to Madinah, he fasted it and commanded the people to fast it. When Ramadan was made obligatory, it became the obligation, and the day of Ashura was abandoned. Whoever wishes may fast it and whoever wishes may leave it, but in fasting it is a great reward.'

english_translation: Abu Ubaydah said: It reached me from Mu'awiyah ibn Abi Sufyan when he came from Makkah and climbed the pulpit. He said: O people of Madinah, where are your scholars? I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say concerning this day: 'The day of Ashura - Allah has not made its fasting obligatory upon you, but I am fasting it. Whoever wishes may fast it, and whoever wishes may break his fast. But in fasting it is a great reward and generous recompense.'
